entities.name: NGO TECHNOLOGY OF PROGRESS
entities.description: The organization whose activities are governed by this policy, committed to high standards of integrity and professionalism

source_anchor.source_text: The activities of NGO TECHNOLOGY OF PROGRESS (hereafter – the "Organization") are based on such values as activeness and care, association and cooperation, responsibility and the rule of law.

entities.name: Standards of Integrity and Professionalism
entities.description: The highest standards of integrity and professionalism that the Organization is committed to maintaining regardless of operating environment

source_anchor.source_text: The Organization is committed to the highest standards of integrity and professionalism, regardless of the environment in which it operates.

entities.name: Working Environment
entities.description: Environment provided by the Organization that encourages high standards of productivity, professional and personal development, achieving organizational goals and prioritizing staff health and safety

source_anchor.source_text: To enable and facilitate the implementation of these commitments, the Organization has committed to providing a working environment that encourages high standards of productivity, professional and personal development, achieving organizational goals and prioritizing staff health and safety.

The Organization is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism
The Organization requires its employees to adhere to the highest standards of ethical conduct
The Organization provides a working environment that encourages productivity, development, goal achievement and staff health and safety

entities.name: Organization Policy

source_anchor.source_text: The policy applies to all staff and governance members of Organization (hereafter – named as Personnel).

source_anchor.source_text: The provisions of this policy may also be applied to partners depending on specific clauses and conditions of the grant agreement, suppliers, sub-grantees, beneficiaries, stakeholders, consultants, external executors, engaged experts, volunteers and other associated entities (hereafter – named as Representatives).

entities.name: Policy
entities.description: The organizational policy document that provides staff understanding and safe working environment

attributes.primary_purpose: provide clear understanding of policies, procedures and practices and healthy, safe working environment
attributes.secondary_purpose: provide overview of security risk assessment and response

source_anchor.source_text: The purpose of this Policy is to provide the staff of the Personnel and Representatives with a clear understanding of the policies, procedures and practices used by the organization and a healthy, safe working environment for staff.

entities.name: Personnel
entities.description: Staff members of the organization covered by the policy

source_anchor.source_text: The purpose of this Policy is to provide the staff of the Personnel and Representatives with a clear understanding of the policies, procedures and practices used by the organization and a healthy, safe working environment for staff.

entities.name: Representatives
entities.description: Representatives of the organization covered by the policy

source_anchor.source_text: The purpose of this Policy is to provide the staff of the Personnel and Representatives with a clear understanding of the policies, procedures and practices used by the organization and a healthy, safe working environment for staff.

entities.name: Organization
entities.description: The organization that owns the policy and assesses, monitors and responds to security risks

attributes.risk_focus: security risks affecting staff and program implementation

source_anchor.source_text: This document also provides an overview of how the Organization assesses, monitors and responds to security risks that may affect staff and program implementation.

relationships.description: The policy provides staff of Personnel with clear understanding of organizational policies, procedures and practices
The policy provides Representatives with clear understanding of organizational policies, procedures and practices

entities.name: Duty of Care
entities.description: A legal obligation of a person to take reasonable care to avoid harm or injury to oneself and/or another person to whom they have responsibility

source_anchor.source_text: Duty of care is a legal obligation of a person to take reasonable care to avoid harm or injury to oneself and/or another person to whom they have responsibility.

entities.name: Breach
entities.description: Breach of a duty of care occurs if a person acts unreasonably or fails to act where action could be reasonably expected and harm is caused to a person

triggers: fails to act where action expected

source_anchor.source_text: Breach of a duty of care occurs if a person acts unreasonably or fails to act where action could be reasonably expected and harm is caused to a person.

entities.name: Reasonable Care
entities.description: The degree of caution and concern for the safety of himself/herself and others that an ordinarily prudent and rational person would use in the circumstances. Failure to exercise reasonable care is considered negligence

source_anchor.source_text: The degree of caution and concern for the safety of himself/herself and others that an ordinarily prudent and rational person would use in the circumstances. Failure to exercise reasonable care is considered negligence.

entities.name: Reasonable Person
entities.description: Another person in the same situation would act in the same or a similar way. Read in conjunction with Definition of Reasonable care

source_anchor.source_text: another person in the same situation would act in the same or a similar way.

entities.name: Risk
entities.description: A situation exposing an individual to danger, harm or loss

source_anchor.source_text: A situation exposing an individual to danger, harm or loss.

entities.name: Harm
entities.description: Harm of any kind including injury or death, damage to property, and economic loss

source_anchor.source_text: means harm of any kind and includes— a) injury or death; and b) damage to property; and c) economic loss

entities.name: Injury
entities.description: Personal or bodily injury including psychological or psychiatric injury, disease, and aggravation, acceleration or recurrence of an injury or disease

includes: aggravation, acceleration or recurrence of an injury or disease

source_anchor.source_text: means personal or bodily injury and includes— a) psychological or psychiatric injury; and b) disease; and c) aggravation, acceleration or recurrence of an injury or disease

relationships.description: Reasonable person definition is read in conjunction with the definition of reasonable care
Breach is defined as a breach of duty of care specifically

entities.name: Persons Directly Involved in Policy Implementation
entities.description: Persons who are directly involved in the implementation of the Policy and have specific security and safety responsibilities

source_anchor.source_text: Persons, directly involved in the implementation of the Policy, are responsible for:

entities.name: Representatives
entities.description: Representatives operating under the conditions set forth in clause 2.2 of this Policy

source_anchor.source_text: Representatives, under the conditions set forth in clause 2.2. of this Policy, and Personnel, are responsible for:

entities.name: Personnel
entities.description: Personnel of the Organization with health, safety and security responsibilities

source_anchor.source_text: Representatives, under the conditions set forth in clause 2.2. of this Policy, and Personnel, are responsible for:

entities.name: Organization
entities.description: The organization whose policy this document represents and whose assets and security must be protected

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring information security of the Organization, including intellectual property;

entities.name: Direct Manager
entities.description: The direct supervisor to whom unsafe conditions and risk control consultations must be reported

source_anchor.source_text: immediately reporting any unsafe conditions or behaviors observed in the workplace to direct manager;

entities.name: Physical Safety Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring the physical safety of life and health of Personnel, including in cases of stay in high-risk areas

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring the physical safety of life and health of Personnel, including in cases of stay in high- risk areas;

entities.name: Organization Information Security Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring information security of the Organization, including intellectual property

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring information security of the Organization, including intellectual property;

entities.name: Personnel Information Security Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring information security of Personnel of the Organization

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring information security of Personnel of the Organization;

entities.name: Material Assets Preservation Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring the preservation of material assets of the Organization and Personnel within the activities of the Organization

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring the preservation of material assets of the Organization and Personnel within the activities of the Organization;

entities.name: Financial Security Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring the financial security of the Organization

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring the financial security of the Organization;

entities.name: Policy Compliance Responsibility
entities.description: Ensuring this policy is complied with, along with other related policies

attributes.scope: this policy and other related policies

source_anchor.source_text: ensuring this policy is complied with, along with other related policies;

entities.name: Reasonable Care and Duty of Care Responsibility
entities.description: Taking reasonable care in the course of their work and accepting a duty of care for their own health and safety, as well as for the health and safety of others within the workplace

attributes.scope: own health and safety and others in workplace

source_anchor.source_text: taking reasonable care in the course of their work and accepting a duty of care for their own health and safety, as well as for the health and safety of others within the workplace;

entities.name: Secure Environment Participation Responsibility
entities.description: Actively participate in building and maintaining a secure environment, through open communication, clear boundaries, managing complaints or disclosure, accurate documentation and notifying appropriate authorities of risk or harm in accordance with relevant procedures

source_anchor.source_text: actively participate in building and maintaining a secure environment, through open communication, clear boundaries, managing complaints or disclosure, accurate documentation and notifying appropriate authorities of risk or harm in accordance with relevant procedures;

entities.name: Risk Reporting Responsibility
entities.description: Anticipating foreseeable harm and risks to self and/or others and immediately reporting any unsafe conditions or behaviors observed in the workplace to direct manager

source_anchor.source_text: anticipating foreseeable harm and risks to self and/or others and immediately reporting any unsafe conditions or behaviors observed in the workplace to direct manager;

entities.name: Risk Control Implementation Responsibility
entities.description: Where foreseeable harm or risk is identified, implementing preventative and risk control measures in consultation with direct manager (where practical) and in line with relevant procedures

attributes.condition: where foreseeable harm or risk is identified

source_anchor.source_text: where foreseeable harm or risk is identified, implementing preventative and risk control measures in consultation with direct manager (where practical) and in line with relevant procedures;

entities.name: Reasonable Care Standard Responsibility
entities.description: Taking the amount of care a reasonable person would expect

source_anchor.source_text: taking the amount of care a reasonable person would expect.

relationships.description: Persons directly involved in policy implementation are responsible for ensuring physical safety of personnel
Persons directly involved in policy implementation are responsible for ensuring organization information security
Persons directly involved in policy implementation are responsible for ensuring personnel information security
Persons directly involved in policy implementation are responsible for preserving material assets
Persons directly involved in policy implementation are responsible for ensuring financial security
Representatives are responsible for ensuring policy compliance
Representatives are responsible for taking reasonable care and duty of care
Representatives are responsible for participating in building and maintaining secure environment
Representatives are responsible for anticipating and reporting risks
Representatives are responsible for implementing risk control measures
Representatives are responsible for taking reasonable care as expected by a reasonable person
Personnel are responsible for ensuring policy compliance
Personnel are responsible for taking reasonable care and duty of care
Personnel are responsible for participating in building and maintaining secure environment
Personnel are responsible for anticipating and reporting risks
Personnel are responsible for implementing risk control measures
Personnel are responsible for taking reasonable care as expected by a reasonable person
Risk reporting requires reporting unsafe conditions and behaviors to direct manager
Risk control implementation requires consultation with direct manager where practical
